title: Liz Cheney tells Colorado graduates to 'stand in truth,' warns democracy is in peril
description: The former U.S. congresswoman (R-Wyo.) and House leader told graduates of her alma mater that America cannot remain a free nation if the truth is abandoned.

title: For Black drivers, a police officer's first 45 words are a portent of what's to come
description: A Black driver is more likely to face being searched, handcuffed, or arrested when a police officer's first words are commands rather than a greeting or an explanation.

title: Dear 'Succession' fans, we need to talk about Shiv Roy in that series finale
description: HBO's Succession ended a four-season run on Sunday night. And Siobhan Roy's final choice exemplifies what the show has been best at, and what its devotees love about it.

title: 8 people were rescued after the partial collapse of an apartment building in Iowa
description: A city official said there had been repair efforts underway on the outside of the apartment complex when it collapsed, after several bricks were reported to have fallen days earlier.

title: A 'natural death' may be preferable for many than enduring CPR
description: Despite its reputation as a lifesaver, for the elderly and medically frail, CPR may cause more harm than good. It's why many doctors opt not to receive it themselves.

title: A new anti-gay law in Uganda calls for life in prison for those who are convicted
description: The bill, signed into law by President Yoweri Museveni on Monday, calls for life imprisonment for anyone convicted of homosexuality. It drew swift condemnation from rights groups around the world.

title: Erdogan's victory could be fateful for Turkey's democracy and role in the world
description: The longtime leader overcame dissatisfaction over high inflation and a slow earthquake response to secure another five-year term as president.

title: Nigeria swears in a new president facing profound economic and security pressures
description: Bola Tinibu takes over as president of Africa's largest economy at a time when the country is facing unprecedented economic and security challenges.

title: A fluorescent green Venice canal is beguiling residents. Police are on the case
description: A shock of bright green appeared in waters near the Grand Canal's Rialto Bridge over the weekend. Authorities say they are working to identify the source of the unusually verdant color.

title: Biden and McCarthy reach a deal to avoid default. Here's what's in it
description: While the bill raises the debt ceiling, it also affects a wide range of people by limiting spending and changing guidelines around food stamps and student loans.

title: How Taiwan used women's voices to send secret messages into China and woo defectors
description: Decades ago, Taiwan set up propaganda broadcast stations on islands right off the coast of mainland China. One of its key tools: women's voices.

title: Thousands evacuated as Typhoon Mawar approaches the Philippines
description: Authorities warned of dangerous tidal surges, flash floods and landslides as Typhoon Mawar blows past the northernmost province of Batanes from Tuesday to Wednesday.

title: North Korea has notified Japan it plans to launch a satellite in the coming days
description: North Korea said that it plans to launch a satellite, which may be an attempt to put its first military reconnaissance satellite into orbit. It said the launch window is from May 31 to June 11.

title: George Maharis, star of TV's 'Route 66' in the 1960s, has died at 94
description: Maharis, a native New Yorker, was one of seven children born to Greek immigrants. He hoped to be a singer but damaged his vocal cords, so he switched to acting.

title: 'Succession' has ended — and the point was never who was going to win
description: The best finales feel both surprising, like you wouldn't have thought of them, and like they were always destined to happen — and Succession's final episode passes the test.
